reviews.review_msg: Great prof. Caring about her students, and willing to listen. Only downfall talks too fast. If you attend lectures, you don't need the textbook. Paper topics were boring.

She is a very nice person, and you can see that she is passionate about politics and is a very knowledgeable person. She did a great job bringing exciting topics to talk about, and raised a lot interesting questions. She is very helpful, and is always there to help her students,and responds to emails extremely quick. The best TA i've had so far.
an easy B - A.

Good news everybody! YOU DON'T HAVE TO GO TO LECTURE AT ALL! I stopped going to class after three lectures cause it was boring and scattered. His exams are 100% from the book and I got an A without using any of his lecture notes. You HAVE to read the book and read it thoroughly. No offense to Mcbride, he's a nice guy he's just not that interesting.

DEFINITELY not for slackers.  Very dense course and it is REQUIRED that you do the readings.  He seems to be very passionate about what he teaches, but tends to move very slowly during lecture and tries to cram everything at the very end.  Ultra boring class if you're not into politics.
13 classes = 26 hours of solitare on my laptop.
He's a really nice guy and knowledgeable but lectures are pretty bland. The text is really easy to follow and most of the content is interesting. Pray for a good TA because they mark everything.

POL 100 with McBride is very easy. Make sure you show up to class and do the readings and that's about as much work you need to do. He's very knowledable but he makes lectures quite dry. The best thing about the course is the textbook. It's very well written and content is extremely useful and informative.

He is a good prof knows what he is teaching but his notes are very unorganized. Tends to do the lecture and whenever he feels like puts down a few notes here and there. Mid term and final was brutal. Also the term paper was pretty hard 2300words for intro course.

The midterm is a nightmare because it is based upon the reading from the first half of the semester. The questions are very pointless. For example, the midterm asks, "How many countries are in the EU in 1998?" Also, he used TURNITIN. Thankyou for this introduction to Political Science, I am not going to take any more Political Science after this.
Lectures were boring. Informative, though I survived without going or paying attention to half of the classes. Books used were pretty easy to read, so keeping up with the class isn't too challenging.

Lectures were a colossal waste of time. SOOOOO boring and dry. None of his writing is legible nore do lectures have any flow to them. I think half the lecture was silence as he thought about what to say next. Final was 4 full essays in 3 hour period. I would say to avoid him if you want to leave the course with any interest in political science!

Awesome Prof.... one of the best courses i have taken thus far... lectures were kinda dry but then again i dont blame him as the content was intro and basic... midterm straight from texts/ccw!!! essays topics very simple!!! Finals 4/13 essays.... you choose 4 of the 13 topics... very easy as he told us ahead of time what is going to be on the exam

Notes very disorganized, but lecs make them clear enough to be understood. Does not cover lots of material during lectures, so READ txt (Very clear. covers most stuff). Don't skip lecs because he may cover detail that text does not. MT is 60+ MC and some para Q's. Final is 4 Essays!  Guarantee pass w/ ok grade if put some effort but hard to get A.

Boring class, his lectures stem from the textbook so you're probably OK with just skipping most of the lectures if you're willing to keep up with the readings. A reasonable amount of readings, and his class seems alright. Challenging, though manageable.

Talk about boring lectures. Awful! Watching paint dry would teach you more about political science. His mid term, taken directly from the textbook, wasn't that easy, nor was his final. However, the term paper topics were pretty good. All that being said he ruined political science for me and I don't plan on ever taking another one again. Boring!

Very dry lectures- it could have been so interesting but he made it very hard to listen to or care about. He was never open to any other opinion other than his own. I felt sorry for the Americans in the class.
Doesn't give a crap about students. Bad teacher.  But still pulled off an A-

She is a great prof who is very knowledgeable and passionate about the things she talks about. She does mark a little tougher and there are weekly assignments that are based on the textbook reading. So you cant get away with not buying the textbook. Marking is a little tough because she often looks for very specific answers. But enjoyed the class.

The course is clear, and to the point. However, the midterm and the final had very strict word counts, if you did not define every term you mentioned in your paper, you would penalised, regardless of the short word count.

Just do your weekly readings (revel and tutorial), attend lectures to reinforce ideas from readings, ask ta's and attend de rooij's office hours for questions (but everything is very clear anyways). really nice introduction to politics and political science even if you don't have that much background knowledge. Heavy on writing abilities.

Not sure if if she is to blame or the content itself but this class was extremely boring. Despite being a nice person, Dr. Rooij was still very unapproachable and had strange word count limits on exams and essays, not enough to get your full point across. Then you would lose marks for not adding more info despite the limited word count LOL.
lectures are very boring. doesn't really give clear criteria. not the worst prof but also don't recommend her

a good teacher but you can not teach her outside of class, she specifically tells you not to email her and that she will not reply. the tests are small so its hard to gauge whats going to be on them (midterm was 12 mc and 1 essay & final was 30 mc, 2 short answer and 1 essay)

You don't need to come to lecture because all slides are posted online. I wish there were more assignments to be graded not, just 2 exams and a paper. I didn't like how we couldn't email her... we had to email our T.A's and her exams are just lecture key concepts and the essay portion is like comparing systems etc.. But it is still hard
The lectures are word for word out of the textbook which she is the author of. Midterm is straight out of the book as well.

The midterm asked fair questions, but only 10 MC so little mistakes dock you big marks. The final exam was accumulative which was really hard. Rooij doesnt prepare you for final at all. Lectures are boring and she says word for word whats on the text book. Dont reccomond taking this class with her. She posts the slides so no need to go to class
So boring, midterms and exams are hard. Just says everything will be on the exams and isn't specific at all. Do not take this class if you do not need too.

course material is super dry, only 1/4 of the class would still until the end of her lectures. Takes existing marks off of the exam instead of giving you a zero for wrong answers, better to leave things blank if you don't know it. Her notes are not that good so it's good to listen, if you can endure it.

Midterm was short and very easy, just memorize the key terms in her slides. She is hard to understand but her slides are online and also come directly from the textbook. Tutorials are beneficial. Dr de Rooij is not really that bad and is tolerable in lectures. She and her TAs are helpful. I wouldn't let her rate my prof deter you from her class.

This class is hard because the prof doesn't know how to use her microphone and no matter where you sit, you won't be able to understand because she mumbles and has a thick accent. Everyone leaves the lecture halfway because everything in lectures is in your $125 textbook. The only time I need the textbook is before the exams. The midterm was easy.

The professor was kind and helpful when I visited her during her office hours. Her tests were reasonable and overall, a surprisingly pleasant experience despite not being familiar with political science. I recommend Bella Aung for the TA as she was generous with tutorial participation and was always available for help when needed.
I found her lectures to be quite engaging. She made the material interesting and the tests were not hard. The tutorials were not so good, though. They were very disorganized.

Prof mumbles in lecture and goes way too fast with her slides but does post slides online after the lecture. Did not like her energy or lectures, however, her exams are fair and easy if you understand the terms.
Boring prof. Lectures are useless because she repeats exactly what's in her textbook. Not a difficult class though, just make sure you memorize the terms and you're gucci. P.S. chilli chilli chilli.

She's okay. She's material oriented and basically it's up to you to learn on your own. Not much is taught in the actual lecture, it's more a set of philosophical questions related to the reading. She's not very student-friendly imo; one is not meant to email her under ANY circumstances.. really? What kind of message does that send to students
She changed the take home final date without addressing it, marks attendance in lecture, boring lectures, biased opinions on politics, not hard course material however easy to get a good mark
Her lectures are VERY boring and the grading criteria was unclear for assignments. I would recommend anyone else in the department over her.

Her class was easy. There is a midterm, which got turned into an essay due to the strike and a final take-home essay. What you get depends on how your TA marks, attendance in lectures doesn't matter a whole bunch, but it does in tutorials. Slides are super boring just black and white and you tend to get bored easily. Overall easy pass.

Greg is a total fox.  He's a snappy dresser, he doesn't care who comes to his lectures or leaves during them because he's so laidback.  It's really too bad he's not younger...if it weren't for how cute he is, i probably would dose off in class. poli sci is a pretty boring subject. At least he likes it.
Can't POLI SCI find someone better? zzzzzzzzzzzzz
No Comments
Why is this guy so monotonous for?
"He's a cowboy, on a steel horse he rides . . ."
Kevin was an awesome TA this semester! He offered really helpful feedback on our assignments which was great to have. Also, he was super nice in tutorial and made the class more fun.

Good lecturer. He is able to keep students from falling asleep. 
 If you have questions, he answers them without confusing you. 
 Always wore a suits haha

Pretty easy course, midterm and final were pretty straight forward and fair.  Interesting lectures that keep you awake.  Nice professor that gives you second chances if you screwed up something by mistake.  Recommended.

I have absolutely no interest in Poli sci...but this prof did his best in making the course interesting! The MT, Final and Paper was very fair. As long as u read the text, u will know what is going on! This is a course that benefits people who watch global news! Cuz u will have a lot to say and bs on in the paper! Also this prof is hawt haha!
His mt is easy. The long questions are a bit harder, but you will be fine as long as you have really read his notes and the textbook.
Super easy class. Tutorials are mandatory not lectures.

I rarely rate my profs here. But Brian is an exception... His teaching style is absolutely disorganized and he can laugh for no reason all of a sudden. The only advantage of this is that he provides a study guide before exams. So if you have to take a class with Brain, be ready to teach yourself (that was basically what I did).

His exams were really easy; he gave out the questions in advance so we would know what would be on there and prepare our answers. I personally did not find his lectures as helpful, but the tutorials were much better for my understanding of each topic.

Brian is a good person. However, he is very odd, and his lectures are very dull. He is very hard to understand. He mumbles to himself, he laughs at his own jokes, and I think he has an asthma problem. Try not to take this course. I thought I did pretty well but I basically taught myself.

Please save yourself and do not take a class with Brian Thomas. Lectures were long and boring and I would not understand anything that Brian was saying. He mumbles and laughs to himself a a lot. Your best friend is the review guide for the midterm and final. Just pray that you get a good TA.

Brian Thomas is just a terrible at teaching. He mumbles when he speaks which makes it difficult to understand and he does care to record lectures. He rambles and gets off topic and the lectures are terribly formatted. The only positive thing is that he provided review guides for the midterm and the final.

This is for POL151. Brian is incredibly knowledgeable about the content, but is not suited to be a professor. Slides are wall of text, and he goes on esoteric tangents incomprehensible to first year students. The assignments and course load are fair but he doesn't post grades on Canvas, so you're left in the dark about what you've got in the class.

Please just don't take anything with him. Slides are disorganized, midterm was disorganized, he mumbles to himself during lecture. If you have to, try and get through class and just study the textbook, it's genuinely much more exciting and interesting. Memorize the notes for the exams.

He knows what he's talking about and is able to give you ample amounts of info during lecture. A little unorganized, so don't be surprised if your study guide comes to you a day before the test. Overall, a great prof and I would take a class from him again anytime!

Seems passionate about what he is teaching but mumbles to himself and speaks in intonations making it difficult to understand. Focuses only on what he is teaching and doesn't stimulate class discussion. Gave me the vibe that he really doesn't care for his students. I would advise anyone else to stay away from this prof, really. THAK GOD FOR TAs!!

Brian is very disorganized. His slides are a mess, he uploads review guides and slides 1-3 days before the exam (but it is nice that he makes a review guide and his homework is simple), he makes errors in the syllabus about the rights chapters, errors in the exam outline about the day and time, doesn't reply to emails. Smart but not a great prof

Can be passionate about his topic, but due to this he'll talk very fast and often mumble to himself. It's hard to understand what he's saying or the main point he's teaching. He often stares at the ground or the desk when he's talking and doesn't upload lecture slides until right around exam season. I felt I could've enjoyed POL more w/ a diff prof

He is very passionate and smart but he is super unclear as a teacher and you have to read TONS for each week. He makes me not enjoy the material that I otherwise enjoy. I thought I could tackle a this course with him but it was just such a bad decision.

Brian probably is a nice guy. But the problem is that he  doesn't use powerpoints so he writes all over the whiteboard in a very disorganized fashion. His writing isn't neat either so that sucks. He has no concept of time, showing up late and going over time with unnecessary material. His exams are nothing like what he says. BEWARE AND WATCH OUT.
Was usually late to class and disorganized and jumped everywhere with lectures. But exams were super easy and based off lectures and readings, and marked papers easy too.

Rob is the sweetest person you will ever meet. The material is a little boring, but he does his best to make it more interesting. He is very fair with his marking and in general, an awesome teacher!!!

Rob is the sweetest person you will ever meet. He is young and connects to every student at a personal level. The material is a little bit dry, but he does his best to make it more interesting. He is very fair with his marking and in general, an awesome teacher!!!

Very personable, clearly passionate about students and politics. Releases crosswords which are a godsend to study from. Workload is heavy, attend every lecture, start essays EARLY as he does not guide you on it. Exams a little unfair as they require loads of extra reading. My favourite class out of the semester. Great guy!

Great prof and great lectures. Lectures are also recorded, which I found helpful for studying. Read the chapters in the txt that he wrote, as he focuses on those. I had a great TA, Ann, and she made tutorials interesting. She gave us lots of great hints & tips for the exams. Exams and paper were not hard, if you go to class you'll be fine!
never had any experience with poli sci. he made it very interesting. great prof.

I had no interest in politics but with that in mind, the lectures were pretty good. Even though he is quite a bit older than me, I will be the first to give him a hotness rating. His personality is just cute!!
Interesting prof. Interesting class.  Repeats important terms.  Multiple choice is a little tricky.

he's a good prof. did not hear many rants about hating his professorship and teaching. i thought he quite enjoys teaching. very funny and made a dry class much more interesting. can be serious if he wants to be. if i had to take this class again, i would definately do it with him and a great ta. Valerie.
Awesome prof and wicked lectures..hes also a very fair marker
easy tests if you have a nice TA. the tests were really fair with a couple mc's followed by an essay. but the essay was very easy if you studied that topic. entertaining class and great prof
doesn't like to respond to emails
not bad.

Uh, just a feedback on the comment (below), females do not like him b/c of his looks. He is not great looking. He's a funny guy, makes poli sci interesting. I would give two thumbs up for this course!
He's quite funny and a great speaker, but unless you genuinely love poli sci, even that cannot save this incredibly dry class.

Has his own personal agenda. Should be a politician not a teacher due to strong personal opinions. However, females tend to like him so I guess that makes him a great prof? I never new teaching had anything to do with looks.

Overrated! Why do people think he is so warm and friendly? He obviously despises teacher lower level political science and enjoys going on personal rants. Maybe it was the akward attempts at humour that made some students feel wanted?

I hate to be the party pooper, but I can't stand this guy. He was alright before midterms, quite funny and all, but the lectures were terrible for the second half and I found him increasingly annoying. I'll avoid any Heard PoliSci classes from now on.

An excellent lecturer. Marking standards are pretty high; grades are not scaled on a curve and grade cutoffs are strict (no rounding up). Exams are marked very hard with a C average obtained. My T.A.--David--was fair and not out to get us, unlike others.
this guy is one of the best teachers at SFU. highly recommended, easy to listen too, very enjoyable.

Hilarious.  And very adorable.  Enjoyed his stories of growing up in South Africa. I did well on the essay, and MEH on the midterm. Which i hear is strange b/c his midterms are supposed to b easy, and his essays hard. ADORABLE MAN!

Andy is awsome at lecturing~! It was a tough course since I am not familiar with politics but I learnt a lot from this course... The midterm m/c was tough (class average was 2/5)... but the final was easy~! It is a course worth taking~!
the best prof ever... so funny...take this cours with him if you can , he is great , you have lots of fun, i'm sure!!!

Best prof I've had so far. Lectures were always interesting, and more than just regurgitation from the text. Andy is hilarious, and his stories help students to understand the concepts. Very nice, very eager to help. Definitely would take him again.

Great Guy... E-mailed him before semester started.. E-mailed me right back!  Squits a lot when he talks, but that's just his enthusiastic self!  Surely you should take the course with him, he's WONDERFUL!
great prof...funny...always dancing around...but i find the course hard...probably cuz poli sci is just not my kind of course...
awesome to ease into first year studies. i love his dances!
really funny, nice, gave a great intro to pol sci which made me want to continue in this field...my fave prof so far...
He always ads a sense of humour to the lectures. Unlike other professors I won't mention...
Wonderful professor. Very entertaining and informative.
No Comments
Extremly funny class and very knowledable, very hard marker
Andy is fun, but a 10-15 page paper in your very first semester is kinda dumb
No doubt he's entertaining/but not great at upper level stuff/close-minded
Funny, interesting, great prof
Makes the material interesting, made me switch to poli sci
three words:awesome awesome,and Awesome-great at gettin material across and easy
superb! wish there were more teachers like him
no doubt about it, he is a good prof, the test is hard
No Comments
he is like a cartoon. boop pop shoop!
awesome lecturer and keeps u interested
excellent prof...funny...easy to follow...final exam a bit unfair
His intro 100 class made me switch majors to Pol. That says it all
Excellent lecturer, caring personality
pretty funny guy, hard exams tho and essay is too long!
really good lecturer
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
Good lecturer - very entertaining
Very approachable
No Comments
It is difficult to pierce her shell but once you made contact she can be very sympathetic. She is severe but you learn a lot with her, if you wish to.

his lectures are not very engaging and kind of hard to understand. I don't think his marking was bad (he only marked the final), if you follow the criteria you should get a good mark. Marks were based on tutorial participation, a presentation, and the rest were all writing assignments, so it was not too hard to get a good mark if you worked hard.

Nice guy and knows his material well. His lectures are boring but its a politics class so it is expected. Tutorial consisted of 2 presenters a week and small groups answering a question then reporting back to the class. Really tough grading for a first-year class but that is more the TA's. Overall mediocre class.

Lectures were monotone and assignments were graded harder than my 4th year classes. Made up fake SFU protocols so he didnt have to tell us more info about the final. Told us many times that he was trying to prepare us for upper level classes but as someone who has taken many of those, his class was one of the hardest Ive ever done.

Interesting and engaging lectures - they always opened with a YouTube video!  He helps prepare you for midterms and terms papers, and also gives clear instructions.  **Do not write your paper at the last minute - he will be able to tell.**  Fair, decent, cares about his students, and is available if you have questions.

This prof is decent and knows his material well. He is a nice guy and is approachable for help.  However, the material can be boring sometimes and his monotone voice can really put you to sleep but he can still be funny at times. Textbook is not that important but attending lecture and participation is. Overall, not a bad class but not great either

this class was okay. Logan is a good prof and gives good lectures. I was a bit frustrated with the grading on the final exam as the question was a broad questions (that had multiple answers) but only one answer was the correct one. paper was long but if you don't leave it until the last minute it is manageable

kind & u can tell that he's passionate about politics. Lecture slides tend to have paragraph sentences rather than concise information, but was honestly helpful in understanding information if u missed lecture. Midterm & final written essay questions worth a lot. Textbook chapters were very long but u can do okay in tests without reading it all.

Overrated, this is a bad gpa booster if you have other courses that matter. Lectures are a waste and grading is tough, and the 10 page paper is alright if you start early but if you dont get an A on it (which you probably won't) then a B is the best you can do overall, which is horrible for a random intro politics elective
nice prof but grades written answer questions on exams pretty unfairly. term paper also had weird restrictions

Logan was a good prof and I enjoyed his lectures. I found the essays to be a bit unfair as the written answer questions were marked pretty harshly. Also for the term paper, the restrictions on sources was kind of frustrating.
Did not enjoy this class. Lectures slides were massive paragraphs. Professor was unclear on what was important to note & what was not. Would not take again

Dr. Masilamani was a very inspirational and discrete lecturer, my major isn't anything close to political science but it was still an intriguing class to attend. I highly recommend this course to anyone studying a political science or liberal arts major.

Lectures were engaging and the prof was a funny guy. I got by without keeping up with textbook readings but I also have a strong interest/foundation in poli-sci. My TA was pretty useless but I had good tutorial classmates. I didn't think tests were that hard but they had some questions about briefly mentioned things or required some inferencing.

Great prof, good testing

Logan is an engaging lecturer, course content is thorough and always accessible. Attendance isn't mandatory, but encouraged. TAs grade fairly and tests are well written, nothing is made to trick you

Logan is a great professor who is friendly and knowledgeable. He leads great lectures and his assignments/exams are reasonable and fair. I would recommend taking POL 100 as an elective, especially if you have a bit of an interest in politics.

Dr. Logan is very passionate about what he teaches and is a great lecturer. However, during office hours, he offers the bare minimum advice and vaguely repeats what is mentioned in class. When studying for tests, I found using the textbook only helpful and the lecture slides as a guide tool. Overall, Logan is a great prof, but it depends on the TA.

walked into class in the first day and said he wish he didn't choose to do a phd and be a prof. I have never had a worse experience in uni with a prof. he has no communication and does not hold any accountability for his mistakes. prof and ta dont communicate. too much work for a level 100 class. boring lectures, just reads off slides.
Excellent instructor. Nothing much to do. Easy grader
worst lecturer at SFU
Logan is great. No issues. Follow all the instructions and you will do well.
The best prof. for Pol 100. I majored in Political Science and he was the one that got me started. Respected the students and took care of them.
Excellent course and instructor. Content was relevant and helped with understanding the world. Logan is great and will take his other courses.
Excellent introductory class. Logan handled the class well.

If you are at SFU then taking a class with him will increase your general understanding of politics. His knowledge and experience in the fields of IS and Politics is vast therefore students learn a lot
Makes you submit essay online checks for plagiarism for the topics that has chance of being same and conducts for plagiarism
Best professor at SFU. 100% professional and maintains good relationship with students.

Great lecturer, keeps my attention for the whole 2 hours. He is funny at times and the class in general is pretty easy. One of the best things i liked is that he sends everyone all the lecture slides. However, i'd suggest showing up to lecture still because he, again, is a great lecturer and it really helps to understand the material better.

Great Prof! His exams are straightforward and short (takes no more than 90 mins to complete). But make sure to have some extensive knowledge on a political topic for the essay. Other then that, the M/C and the short answer are a breeze. Also, don't procrastinate with the 10 page paper like I did. It's very hard to do bad in this course w/ Logan.

Prof gives out super clear and easy to understand lectures. Most of the questions on his exams are from his lectures but there are a few from the textbook, and he literally tells you what the written questions are going to be. 10/10 would recommend gpa booster
Awesome prof! Try and take tutorial with him. My favourite prof from SFU.

Love this professor! Professor Logan explains his lectures really well, it's easy to understand and his midterm was really fair. He basically tells you what is on the midterm and final. However, the research paper topic requires a lot of time. As long as you put effort in it, then you will do good :) Strong recommend this class !!!!!
Decent prof, was much easier  than I had anticipated. I would definitely recommend him.

He is very chill and knows what he is talking about. His notes are very vague so attending lecture would be wise. If you attend lecture, reading the text book isn't too necessary. He makes the subject not dry, and puts humour into his lecture. Slides are sent to email every week. Approachable, and will clarify if needed
Awesome prof! Super generous marker when it comes to tests. Participate in tutorial and come to class then you won't need to read much at all. Essay was a bit harder!
He's a cool Dr. If you want good grades, try participating in class. Make sure he knows you/your name and Start up your term paper on time
Not very helpful. Tough marking! Be careful to take this course. One of the most difficult in a 100 level

great prof, easy midterm and final. most important part is he points out which question will be on the exam before each test. the essay is a little bit long and need to spend a lot of time to do the research. after all, excellent  prof!

Easily one of the easiest classes/nicest profs around. Even though everything seemed like common sense, he uses real life examples that I thought were interesting. He also kind of has a deadpan type of humor.
Good professor! Pay attention, study a little and try to get along with him! You can make it!

Logan is one of the greatest teacher I have had thus far. I had absolutely no interest in politics prior to this class and I can honestly say I really enjoy it now. He makes sure not to scare first year pol sci students away and makes the class very manageable.

Easily the best prof I've ever had. I've had him for 2 classes now and I've done super well in both! He's very approachable and is well educated in what he teaches. Classes with him are not difficult because he actually tries to make sure you understand what you're learning.
the grading scheme was unfair.MCQs for exams were easy.

Very good professor. I had little interest in politics before this class, and only took it because I had to. Now I'm very interested in the subject. His lectures are concise, and he gives you a very clear indication what is going to be on the exam. Marking is fair, just put some effort in and you'll get a solid grade. The text is very interesting.

Study hard! Then you will be able to get an A! He is really fair in evaluating each student, along with the TAs, and he and the TAs were really helpful getting through this course. Really recommend him if students are going to take Political Science courses.

Logan is a funny, interesting prof who made political science fun.He needs to use the microphone, so consider sitting in the front row depending on your hearing ability. His exams are fair. Study selectively, he mentions in class that certain topics will be tested. =) SF, LT and RC

Excellent prof to take poli sci with, and I learned so much from him! I thought political science would be an absolute nightmare, but he has made it so much more interesting and bearable. I learned a lot in his class and he makes it fun!
i enjoyed pol class with him. Although lecture notes were short, it had all materials that we need to know. Exams were fair.

I found him to be a well-spoken individual. His lectures are 80% based on the textbook but he clarifies any points that may be confusing. Lectures are key as he tells you exactly what will be on the midterms and the final. I found him to be very approachable after class.

Amazing!!!!!!. Don't listen to the others who say he's terrible. I think we should have more professors like him who are clear and concise on what is expected. If you listen to him and attend lectures you will do great. Plus his class was so interesting and relevant to current events that I found it hard to fall asleep in any of his lectures.
He`s a good prof.One of my best infact!

I really don't understand why people are complaining about him. He is an awesome professor. His accent is so alluring and he makes the class so interesting. I learned so much from this guy then I could from any other professor. Also he doesn't exhaust the two hour maximum lecture time and lets us out early at times. He's the greatest nuff said
His powerpoint presentations every class sum up the reading material succintly and really help to organize your thoughts about the material.
Such a boring class. Be aware he is a hard marker on term paper. His exams are little bit hard. If you dont wanna waste your money, take the course w/ other prof.

extremely boring professor.  i could never sit through the entire 2 hours of the class.  by the way, the multiple choice questions he pulls them out of the practice multiple choice questions from his and aheard`s online site.
he is such a hard marker and essay even worths 35% .. take this course w/ other prof..

The Prof really knew his stuff about the subject matter but his lectures were terribly boring. Make sure you read through the main points in the text and take notes in lecture and you should be fine for tests. It was fairly easy but also quite boring.
Lectures are really boring but he knows what hes talking about, he was also my TA and hes a very reasonable marker and the class was very easy. I hate poli sci but it was an interesting class.
Rambles a lot during lecture, but clearly knowledgeable. Very hard marker for exams and term paper, but I still ended up with an okay mark.

Lecture:Just read through the slides (his has use the same slides for many years as I concerned)
 
 Grading:Totally unfair, the final essay count 35% in total grade. But he is a very hard marker...I should be happy because I got B from this class, but all my other courses are either A or A-...couple of my friends failed...
excellent teacher

Absolutely god-awful.  I suspect he may be a brilliant political scientist, but he's a horrible professor.  Rambling notes in ALL-CAPS and really hard to pick out what he thought was important.  Oh yeah, and the world's going to end.  Tomorrow.

Yes, he is very hard and his expectations for a 100 level class were too high. However, he was a fair teacher and for an upper level class I'm sure he would be very good. He has Teaching Excellence awards, so he cares about his students. If you work hard and do the readings (which is expected in University)you will be fine. He does bash religion.
No Comments
one of the worst profs I've ever had, he's prejudiced against religion and continually bashed it in his lectures

Note that any of the good reviews come from upper division classes. This guy was on sabbatical and has been eased back into teaching with POL 100, which is supposed to be an intro course. However, Ross teaches it like an upper division or graduate level class. Not really introductory. The essays are marked hard, especially with his reviews. Take a

PLEASE STOP THE DAILY NEWS READINGS!!! He is probably a better instructor for higher level courses because his overhead notes are complicated and articulation are just too much for first years. I expected to get an "introduction" but it seemed more like a 3rd year course!

remember to drink a cup of large coffee before class. this guy is extrememly difficult. make sure that you have a strong background in politics. the midterm was insanely difficult, cuz it was basically a 3 hour midterm, but we only got 2 hours to write it.

just horrible.DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS!this is not a 100-level course,its a 300 level course.first-years beware!This is a weeder course, you're better off taking calculus!His teaching method is non-existent, he only discusses current events,which makes everyone fall asleep.readings are brutal,no quality help available.10000 word essay,for first years!

His lectures were extremely entertaining, and quite helpful for prepping the MT and Final. Can't say the same about the texts assigned though. Overall, loved his classes and I would definitely take another class with him.
Thinks to much of himself. Does accept opinions that differ from his own. His choice in ta's in terrible. Worst pol sci prof in the department.
Interesting lectures, well organized, relevant assignments. Overall, the class was a good experience, but don't expect an A, he is a hard marker esp. on essays.

I am an engineering student but I took pol100 as elective and by far it has been the best class I ever had. Dr. Muller makes lectures so much fun, you find it hard to resist going to them. He is also alway well dressed and organized.

One of the worst profs I have had. His lectures do not match up with the assigned readings. The selection of readings that are assigned are poor. Maybe he is a good graduate prof, my he shouldn't be teaching an intro to pol sci class.

Uvic can have him back. He brings down the political science dept. at sfu, He's lectures are uncoordinated and he doesn't like views that differ from his own. Avoid any class with him. I know that there is a storage of people to teach poli sci classes but any student doing there MA or PHd would be better than him

This class was the worst Experience of my post secondary studies. With over 100 credits completed I have a few professors to compare against. Zero Prof-TA communication, obviously did not read course books before assigning them, lack of interest in material and students.  These are the sentiments of most in the class.  Do NOT take a class with Ben!

Average prof. He might make a better upper division teacher but for 100 he was a bad choice. Lectures are totally unco-ordinated. He also expects us to replicate the textbook and lectures on tests/ papers and punished outside research, especially if it went against the political views he was cramming down our throat. TA's taught us everything.

Worst prof at Simon Fraser.  Brutal.  Makes me not want to take another Poli Sci Course.  Lectures are borderline lunacy--just brutal.  Marking is maniacle--even worse.  Do NOT take any lower level classes with this man.  I feel like I wasted my money.  I do not recall any of my classmates liking this prof--even those of us that enjoy Pol.

As said already, he'd be an awesome 300 and 400 level prof. Teaching POL 100 was a horrible decision on someone's part. This should be the most basic course available, and it consisteded of namedropping dead french philosophers. Interesting? Sure, yeah. But the expectation that a bunch of kids out of High School can survive this class is ludicrous.

Worst prof ever.  No structure to lessons, would make a good 300 or 400 level teacher but he teaches Pol 100 like a 300 level class.  Very very bad, I would never take another lower level course with him.
Anal about making material available, Says hes not used to teaching 100 level courses, lectures are unrelated to examinable material, TA's have to teach us basically everything

David teaches at CapU now. It was important to at least skim through the chapters or remember key points so you can participate by answering a couple of his questions. The class was graded by two separate short paragraphs written about a current event that relates to topics in the class. As well as a fair mid term and final. Favourite prof in 3 yrs
Worst experience ever, waste of money and time.

I love David! Absolutely incredible style of teaching! Super engaging and genuinely a nice guy. Political Science is not my strong suit, but he made the class fun and interesting. Would recommend him to anyone.
I love his non partisan style of teaching political science
Best teacher ever.
Great professer. Sometimes he use textbook sometimes not. But overall great. Very easy

His intro class is what inspired me to pursue Political Science as my major. Although his lectures may sometimes be word for word, you can tell he truly cares about what he's teaching and if his students understand the material rather than pushing out loads of content. If he's teaching ANY class, TAKE HIM. Make sure you read his slides for tests!

Professor Prest seems really passionate about what he teaches, which makes lectures more interesting. He connects course content to world events and makes class engaging. Course content can be a bit general or boring at times, but it's a 100 level course so that's expected. Overall, he's a really good prof and I enjoyed taking this class with him!

I had Dr. Prest for POL100 a couple semesters ago. He's a fantastic lecturer and is very passionate. However, POL100 is NOT a GPA booster like many would care to think - keep up on the subject matter, ask questions/critique/areas for improvement and you WILL do well. But don't expect it to be a walk in the park.

Dr. Prest was is a great prof. Exams were 48-hour take-home exams and the research paper was easy! I recommend taking this class and participating in tutorials to boost GPA. His lectures were not to long and they were not boring.

This class is very difficult for an intro class. The midterm and final consisted of take-home prompts, which often included very detailed and difficult concepts to comprehend and put together into a paper. Do not take this class if you are not willing to put in the effort by reading the weekly readings, attending tutorials and office hours.

Mr.Prest was honestly such an amazing professor he was easily accessible and would respond to emails quickly. His lectures do tend to get a little boring but overall from a student who didn't know much about politics, Mr.Prest makes it so much more easier to understand concepts. You can get a good mark if you put in the time.

Dr. Prest is an ok prof. If you are not interested in politics, then do NOT take this class. Lectures were very boring bc prof talked for the whole 1hr 50 min. Readings + tutorials are boring as well. 2 papers + 2 exams (that were also papers), so 4 papers in total. Weekly written assignments. Not an overwhelming course, but very boring.

Easy class. Two papers and a take-home midterm and final. If you attend either the lecture or do the reading, youll be fine. Dont expect to do papers in a day. You need to make sure your writing communicates your reasoning clearly, otherwise youll lose a decent chunk of your grade. Prest can be robotic at times, but is otherwise a nice guy.

Cara's lectures can be a bit of a drag, with her tendency to read straight off the slides. However, the textbook and discussions with the TA proved far more helpful for understanding the concepts. unstuck study was a great study tool to supplement the class material.

Sometimes it actually sounded like she was having a stroke when teaching? She was very mumbly and all over the place, even though she was reading from slides. And the slides themselves didnt really have a cohesive narrative: it was sorta all over the place information that needed to be explained... and then wasnt.

Extremely poor at delivering lectures. Uninspired & unpassionate cadence in her voice (MONOTONE, CONGESTED). My impression is that she is, in fact passionate about what she teaches, but I wouldn't fault anyone who disagrees; her slide-reading habit makes attending lecture effectively non-imperative. She has gained a rep among POLI students for this

Oh my god! Never in my life have I met a professor as boring and pointless as Cara Camcastle. Her lectures are absolutely useless - she reads off her slides, word for word, and expects us to understand what she means.  Furthermore, her exams are impossible. She does not cover the information necessary to pass the exams. The worst professor ever!
The tests and essays have no rubrics makes it really hard to know how to answer the questions and where your marks are going, and her lectures are very boring though she is nice.

Cara is one of the worst professors I have come across. She reads off her slides, where there is little to no explanation of examples or concepts. The textbook single-handedly carried me through this class, as lectures were not necessary. Some class discussions helped in answering study questions. If you are good at self-teaching then I recommend.

RMP needs an "avid slides reader" tag for this one. I attended maybe 6 lectures and paid attention in 2. All you gotta do is read the textbook and understand the concepts well--some tutorial discussions were based on applying concepts to real life situations. She's nice but seems more passionate about research and penguins than teaching.

Camcastle does not know how to teach, the course itself is not too bad as long as you have a good TA that you can ask questions to. Half the class doesn't go to her lectures because all she does is read off slides, the textbook is more helpful than her. The workload isn't bad though: 3 quizzes, a short paper, and a term paper.

Worst university-level professor I have ever met. She reads off her slides, causing so much confusion. She would have a slide titled "1927" and points such as "Women issues" and "Monumental impact", and not explain anything. Instead, she'd go on and on about random political issues, and explain information, completely unrelated to the course.

Cara is a very kind person. But she does not know how to address a lecture hall the size of pol 100. by the end of the term probably 1/10th of people showed to lecture for they were just that unapplicable to the course material. Exam questions were either given before hand or open book. Overall you'll rely on google and the textbook. Do. Not. Take.

Don't waste your time watching her lectures  her lectures would only make you more confused, and all she does is go off topic. She is horrible at communication because she told our class that our last quiz is going to be short answer but she changed her mind and made it MC without telling the class right away.

Her lectures are all skeleton notes and speaks so quietly, can't hear. Despite so many complaints by students, the prof never alters her lecturing style; it is almost like she does not seem to care whatsoever. The textbook only came in to use for the midterm and final when she gave us the definitive review. Also, she never answers anyone on Canvas.
amazing professor! a relatively easy marker too

Extremely eloquent speaker, engaging and insightful. Content was pertinent to the class and very thought provoking. I had him in my first year and honestly his existence made me consistently disappointed in the quality of the other professors I would eventually encounter.

He is a very respectable professor, very intelligent and is very knowledgeable about what he teaches. He also responds to questions very clearly and tries to help students understand the material as best they can. His exams were essentially composed of the material he gave in his notes, so make sure you study those well.
Rmi was an amazing teacher: comprehensive, understanding, helpful. This class was based on midterms and papers, very easy to stay up to date with the lectures if you go to class and the tutorials.
He's a good teacher, but I didn't learn well with him, mainly because he was distracting. If you know what he looks like, you'll understand.
How can you not take his classes Very interesting lectures and fair grader. A definite yes on your list of profs to choose.
Very straightforward lectures and exams, boring textbook, but good looking!
He is a nice professor. What was good about his course was that he would explain the concepts and write out the notes we needed, so we knew for sure what he was going to focus on for his exams.

If you appreciate a prof who actually organizes lectures and reveals interest in the course material, take a class from this prof.  Very intelligent, very knowledgeable, approachable in terms of asking questions during class.  A+.

He really knows his stuff and his tests are easy enough b/c he tells you what's on them.  He makes the material very comprehendable...you don't even need the textbook because his notes include anything you need to know. The only complaint about him is his messy handwriting :( Oh, and my Ta was dumb.
No Comments

Great Prof, one of the best I've had, enjoys teaching, has great sense of humour and is very knowledgable.  Definatly has messy writing but his lecture is at a good pace.  Recommended and he uses the same course material from semester to semester so you can probably get the courseware used.
Awesome prof! Very clear (though bad hand-writing lol) and made even boring topics interesting.  My TA was great by the way and I didn't find the marking THAT hard.

Lectures and notes are extremely clear. Very interesting discussions in class. Tells you exactly what's in the exams. But they are long, so watch out for time. Don't bother with the textbook, his notes will suffice. Great prof!

best prof. to teach pol 100 so far from my opinion, great guy, amazing lecture notes, everything needed for midterms and finals, u get a good idea of whats gonna be on it from what he says, bad handwriting though, but hes a great prof.

Great prof, his lectures were really fun. His overhead notes are at a great pace and are all you really need for tests.. I don't even know why I bought the text. The paper topics were pretty interesting. You can sort of tell where he lies politically. I liked his accent, made notetaking challenging.

Great notes cause they really help u on midterms & finals. His handwriting - terrible. TAs are HORRIBLE; so try & switch ASAP if u sense u have a bad TA. He tells u whats on the midterm & final but they are all written answers, no MC. Keep up w/ readings. Term paper topics i found challenging.

Super knowledgable and makes boring subject interesting and easy to understand.  Not very approachable though, and TAs are AWFUL, they dont know much and mark wayyyyy to hard.  I would totally recommend James though, he rocks!  PS-he totally doesnt have a political agenda, what are u talking about?

excellent prof. makes good use of lectures, but handwriting is atrocious. still, he makes potentially confusing material very clear. also very clear on essay expectations and what to review for exams. not too approachable, always seems busy. hope for a good TA!
Great Prof. Exam is long though. find it hard to finish within the time limit. but prof is really good. i don't like the class, but i guess that's just b/c i don't like poli sci.

he is a knowledgeable professor and very enthusastic about the subject. There should be a ratemyTA. The TA I had for this course marked extremely hard and unreasonably. Horrible experience with TA this semester!!!

hilarious guy who can laugh at himself.  again, handwriting and spelling are major issues:)  however, he makes everything very clear and makes sure that he says what he is writing.  also, he's good with questions.

very clear, although his handwriting is not. He understands that his notes are hard to read and makes sure everyone fully undrestands what is written. He is passionate about the subject and he always finds a way to bring in a little humour. Overall he seems really nice.

This prof is horrible! He is arrogant, absent minded, BORING, and has a political agenda of his own. In a first year class, I don't think it is appropriate to tell your students to vote for the BC Liberals.

Teacher is awesome. He writes out all the notes for you on the overhead at the perfect speed. He also gives out an outline for the exams. You don't have to read the text, but it is easy to read. He makes getting an good grade easy. THE TA'S SUCK! They don't know what they're doing or how to teach!

He is an awesome prof, explains things very well.  Information provided very relevant to the exams.  Too bad his TA's do not know how to mark.  TA has no clue about anything, lacks confidence, should never become a teacher.
Very nice professor, makes jokes and usually answers questions. Notes and tutorial readings are key during exams.

Busumtwi-Sam is a high quality prof. His detailed notes rendered doing readings virtually useless. He comes off as being a bit of a hardass after the first lecture but after a few lectures he lightens up and is interesting to listen to.

he doesn't try to trick you on exams, so your never suprised and know exactly what your going to be tested on. he hints on the essay topics all throughout lectures, so if your listening, you definatley will not be suprised when finals come around!
Interesting opinion that Politics can be understood like a hard science (which presonally I don't agree with). Intersting background, ok prof, nothing bad to say about him

Near-illegible writing, which is a definite problem, but that's basically the only one. He'll seem really gruff on the first day, but his bark is worse than his bite. He likes to listen to the ideas of the people in his class.

he practically tells you what's going to be on the midterm! gives out sheets with definitions, all you have to do is know those and you'll get an A on the tests. overall, interesting and passionate prof, seems strict, but it's only on the outside!
hes really cool and fun to talk to. he really knows his stuff and for an intro class he made it fun
Very clear and consise - his notes are great too.
Great prof, definitely made me interested in poli-sci. funny too! he writes as he talks so you can keep up with his lecture.
he writes tooooooooooooooo fast....can't read his writings AT ALL!!!!
Run while you can... run and never look back!
my first and last pol sci course
He's an assy professor, who writes too fast, and can't teach
No Comments
He gave a good review of elementary concepts
A genius in his own mind
Seemed pretty cool.  And I got a lot out of his course.
Lots of fun to watch

Doesn't express himself clearly. Ever. He always says that he said something but he never said it. Didn't give us a syllabus at the beginning of the year. Never tells you what he wants. It's the end of semester and I still don't know what our class was about

Sanjay was a great professor with engaging lectures. I am not interested in politics, I took this course as a requirement and he made the content so interesting that I was actually excited to go to class. My TA was excellent, she provided great clarification on any confusing topics and made tutorials fun.

though i thought the lectures were slightly useless, sanjay is such a down-to-earth prof. the midterm and final were fairly easy, but the paper was not. the criteria was not clear, and TAs would take points off for miniscule things (i got 0.25 off for some random thing). overall, the course is easy, just depends on your TA

Good professor all around. Easy to understand, approachable, pretty nice. The one assignment we did have was a little hard to understand the criteria but the tests' criteria was relatively understandable. The textbook readings are not essential or mandatory but you do need to do the readings for the tutorial as there will be questions asked.

Sanjay was super passionate and intelligent. The midterm and the final were easy if you were prepared, but the assignment was confusing. Exams are entirely based on the lectures, so I didn't bother reading the textbook after the midterm. However, he talks quickly and uses complicated political terminology for an intro course. Tutorials were fun.
I found the course pretty easy. Most people I spoke to got As or A-s in the course.

Sanjay was my first intro to any pol courses and as someone with close to no political background his lectures werent the easiest to follow. he spoke way too fast and often said things that made no sense. if u put in the work on ur own you will do fine. dont rely on textbook, use the tut readings and lec slides which are clear and posted weekly.

The "uh, um, sorry I mean" during lecture was distracting. Explanations on lecture material were not super clear. I felt like I had to teach myself the material. Exams were harder than they needed to be. I found the papers for the critical review overly difficult to comprehend, especially with no background in the field. TA was a tough grader.

As someone who had basically no background knowledge of politics, I thought I wouldn't do good in POL 100. Sanjay is an amazing professor, but I had to focus really hard on what he was saying because he talked pretty fast. Caley is such a great TA. If you put in the work, you'll do fine.

The professor's teaching style often made the material harder to grasp than it needed to be. Exams, in particular, were challengingnot because of the content itself but due to poorly worded and confusing questions. It was often difficult to understand what was being asked, which created unnecessary stress during assessments.

Sanjay himself is NOT THE ISSUE. This is 100 lvl poli course, which should not be difficult! That is what I thought, then was hit with a 50 on my paper, marked against stuff not on the criteria. The T.A's can and will sink your mark. The exams r pretty easy + scales if everyone does bad.
I had taken a POL class already so found this pretty easy. Prof Jeram is was recommended by friends and lived up to what they said. He gets passionate about some topics.

He's pretty passionate about what he teaches, his lectures are interesting in my opinion and he is often available to help you if you ask through email. Although I feel like you have to put quite a bit of effort to do well if you don't know much about political science (at least for me).
took this class as a requirement his exam was so hard I legit failed he does not care bout his students lectures r super bland
LITERALY AN L CLASS DO NOT TAKE WARNING!!!! THE CLASS WAS NOT IT!!! IF YOU WNNA FAIL ONLY THEN TAKE IT
the midterm was 40% and the average was like a low-mid C. overall hes a nice person but the class did not eat!!

He goes on and on in lectures and half of it is just repetition of what he had already stated. The midterm was horrible (50% MC and 50% written) , questions on the smallest details that were only said once. His slides are basically useless, there's barely anything on it. Tutorials were helpful but the TA's were hard markers.

Sanjay was an amazing professor and had a straight-forward class. I took this class during the semester when the TA strike took place, so the course was adjusted (no term paper). However, mid-term was quite straight forward with no trick questions and the final exam was fairly easy. Quizzes are posted randomly so stay up to date!

Overall a great professor, easily one of the top 3 I've had in 3 years. I took this course in my third year and found it pretty straightforward. Prof Jeram is very balanced and uses research to help you understand politics. I still have no idea what his actual opinions are.

Great prof but he goes over a lot of topics very fast and does not include them in his slides. The tests are equally based on textbook and lectures. I got an A- but I had to put in a good amount of work for it.

Overall Sanjay was a good lecturer. His lectures were easy to follow especially as a first year student. I had no background knowledge on politics but I still managed to do well. I feel like the midterm was unfair as it was extremely hard.
He's super nice and understanding and cares. Just show up to class and pay attention and you'll do fine its fairly easy.

Sanjay is a super chill guy.  Lectures are delivered in an engaging manner and I can tell he really cares for his students.  He can be stern with rules but always extremely fair and responds to emails promptly.  POL100 covers very basic subject matter and if you put in the effort in tutorial, it is no problem to get a high grade in Sanjay's class.
midterms and finals were very unfair, doesnt seem to care about the students. offered .5 credit if you showed up to lecture

Sanjay is one of, if not the best profs I've had in my uni career. He is respected and understands the material that he teaches inside and out. His course is easy to pass if you show up for lectures and pay some attention to it. Because of Sanjay I am switching my major to Political Science. Attendance is mandatory in TUT for participation.

Sanjay was one of the best prof's I have had at SFU. He knew exactly what he was talking about and didn't overcomplicate things. With the help of his TA's I was able to understand the course on a deeper level. I definitely recommend taking any of his classes if you have the opportunity.

Class is quite basic, just a bunch of topics in detail. Keep up with the weekly readings, look over the lectures, study a but before the midterm and final and you should have understanding of 90%+ the material. Just one paper, not very hard.

Tutorials are useless (except for participation marks). My TA did not lay out the term paper criteria properly. Cost me an A+. It's a hard course if you don't know politics. If you work hard with 0 background in politics it's still easy to get a B+

Lectures were confusing at times, because of his vocabulary, but not confusing enough to take away from meaning. Participation in tutorials is crucial to success. Kill the paper and the midterm and you'll be in a fine position for the final. Final is time consuming but not terribly difficult. A good course, even for non-POL majors.
I don't like online courses but Prof Jeram has made things really easy and clear for students. I'm not a political person but still an interesting course.

If lectures matter to you, dont take this class from Sanjay. I have never seen someone speak in such an unclear and disorganized manner. His lectures are long and (most importantly) do not make much sense. No cohesion whatsoever. Good luck on trying to figure out what his main point is. By halfway through, I was only reading the textbook. Avoid!
Solid prof! Engaging and straight forward lectures and super fair assignments.

A great class taught by an amazing prof! Dr. Jeram's lectures were so engaging as he translated ideologies into real world examples. The content was very interesting but it is a lot of reading and the lectures are pretty long, so just don't get caught behind. He cares about his students and is easy to reach out to. My favourite course this sem!

Dr. Jeram provides amazing lectures that are both informative and engaging. His quizzes and his mid terms were fair. We were also given lots of time for a paper which allowed us to request help from either Dr. Jeram or our TA's. I'm not interested in Political Science but Dr. Jeram enabled me to learn and understand the world of politics.

Wow! My expectations for Sanjay's class were pretty high after reading these comments and I have to say, he totally lived up to it. He was super understanding when I had a COVID scare which was a highlight for me, you can tell he really cares about his students. Can't wait to take another class with him!

Honestly one of my favourite profs and would 100% take a class with him again. Lots of textbook reading plus extra readings for tutorial. The quizzes were very easy. Theres one big paper, but that was also very simple. Overall if you like politics and want to have a base understanding of it take this class!

I cannot, within 350 characters, express how grateful I am for Dr. Jeram's care. Long story short, 2020 has been extra rough for myself and through all that a glimmer of hope fell from the sky. With 5 courses, run-ins with COVID, and trips to the hospital my guy Dr. Jeram has been nothing but understanding through everything I have been through.

Good prof, although I felt his lectures were difficult to understand due to his complex vocabulary. Quizzes every couple of weeks, but he lets you collaborate with others (might just be for online though). The midterm was difficult but I ended up getting an A so it might've been stress. Just study both the textbook and lectures and you'll be fine!

Pretty easy social sci elective, the concepts can be a lot but as long as you review the lecture slides before the midterm and final, you'll do fine. The TA can make or break the class because discussions in tutorials are pretty formal and structured (at least in my tutorial it was). Overall, not too much work required in this class.
This is an easy elective to take. Provided you pay attention in class and attend tutorial it will be an easy GPA boost.
Organized course easy to get a good grade.

Sanjay is a nice guy but the vocabulary he uses is way too advanced. He uses words you have to look up in the dictionary when doing his lectures. Other than that the class is extremely easy, especially if you know a little about politics.

I had a tough time with this course but came in with zero political knowledge. Prof Jeram is the only prof I had for a big class who will take the time to really help when you ask. I'd take another course with him for sure.

He's very clearly engaged in lectures and shows he wants students to succeed. But, his lectures/slides had lots of unnecessarily complex wording to explain simple concepts which made it difficult to keep up. I can never really understand what he's trying to say either. Barely used my textbook and still got a good grade.
Just finished this course, I think I did well enough on the final. Prof Jeram did a really good job moving the course online, you have to give him props for that!

The way this class is taught is not at a 100 level. It is expected for you to already know terms and politics, terms are not explained but just given examples of how they are used and if you don't know the subject to begin with you will not understand what is going on. The tutorials are unhelpful, and not based off lectures. Exam questions are hard

Sanjay is one of the nicest guys @SFU. Super knowledgeable and kind, clear in his lectures and test content, surprise quizzes but eliminates ur worst one. He answers questions in lecture in great detail and even structures tutorials for the TAs so we are all at the same place in the course and our understanding is relatively consistent.
Took this course but not in pol sci. The course requirements are straightforward and not hard to get an A if you study.

He was an awesome/fair prof. He did talk too much and made no sense at times. I went to class only twice. HOWEVER, if you take his midterm you'll know what type of questions he'll ask for the final. I studied his notes on my own and made sure to pay attention to the smaller details! I got an 85 on the final, however, others found his final tough!

He talks WAAAAAAAAAAY too much in lecture. Lecture also gets very boring because he is NON STOP TALKING and TALKING and TALKING. Everyone around me and everywhere basically skip class because it gets super boring. TA's also never return emails and are very boring to attend too as well.

Great prof, really helpful and understanding when you go see him. His lectures are decent. Pretty basic stuff but he's a good clear speaker. Exams are tricky unless you know your stuff well. Go to him for help, not the TAs.

I took this class as a filler course knowing it wasn't going to be a gpa booster. The exams were hard imo, especially the written portion. But the paper made up for my mark. Lectures were dry and boring but theres pop quizzes in lecture. You basically read the textbook but Sanjay is easily reachable.
Pretty easy intro class. Tutorials feel like a waste of time but easy to get 10/10.
Just saw that I finished with A, a nice surprise. Good professor, makes you work but clear grading criteria.

He seems like a nice professor and all, but his exams were pretty difficult. The lectures are pretty useless and vague, so be prepared to read and memorize the textbook. I wouldn't recommend this course as a GPA booster because it isn't one.

Not sure what these others are talking about, I'm not a political science person and didn't find it hard to get an A. Pay attention to the lectures, use the study guide and you'll be fine. If you want a GPA booster where you can skip class and do well, not this class.

Eh, class is definitely not a GPA booster. Readings and lecture are very boring, however professor Jeram tries his best to make lectures interesting. Midterm was hard and tutorials were useless, so get ready to memorize the hell out of a boring ass book.. If you have an interest for politics, go ahead and take the class, otherwise don't bother.

Took the class as a GPA booster. Lectures and reading can be dry, but the issue I found with him is that his midterm was very vague from the lectures - if you didn't memorize the textbook, you won't pass the class. Also, tutorials were a waste of time, as the course material wasn't talked about AT ALL and was not testable.10/10 would not take again

ok i seriously don't know why people are saying his class is a gpa booster/easy mark class when it's clearly not. this is not a basic intro class so good luck if you have zero knowledge in politics. he'll say the midterm is "basic" when it isn't.
It's a pretty basic intro class, lectures can be interesting, but sometimes dry. He lays out the requirements well, which are straightforward and easy if you study.

Not a great prof. He does not tell you what's going to be on the midterm and exam so you pretty much have to read your textbook and memorize the whole thing to get a good mark. This class is not a GPA booster.
One of the best POL profs at SFU. Very passionate and approachable. Marking was fair.
Really nice guy, lectures are a bit dry but go to them as he gives hints about questions on the final ESPECIALLY the last lectures.

Good professor teaching pretty basic government and politics content, if you're a half decent social science major this class is more than fair. Lectures are kind of dry, and his slides are really basic and don't really cover what he says, but the textbook fills in the gap just fine. Sanjay Jeram is also a handsome man with a nice jawline.
Generally a good prof who has clear expectations. Helps that hes cute and funny in a nerdy kinda way.

i went into this class knowing nothing about poli sci, and got an A-. Sanjay's class was fair because as long as you know what your talking about and can back it up you'll do well. the textbook isn't needed, but it explains things better. there was one paper which was 1500 words, pop quizzes, and 2 exams. tutorials are key to understanding better.

super professional guy. I loved how specific the midterm and final outlines were, he told us exactly what we had to study (give definitions and importance of 10 vocal terms from class, some multiple choice, and in final there was also 2 essay questions, tho he gave the 5 potential topics beforehand) study hard and you'll do great.

Sanjay is a great professor who seems to genuinely care about the success of his students. There is a lot of course material but his lectures aren't boring. Would definitely recommend starting the term paper well before the due date and going over it with him or your TA.
